Flink launched in February 2021 and already operates in more than 90 cities in Germany, and the Netherlands. The business generated more than EUR 400m in revenues in 2022 and is operationally profitable. Flink is backed by the world‚Äôs most renowned tech investors, including Prosus, Mubadala, and Bond, and strategic investors like Doordash and REWE. As a Data Analyst (m/f/d) in our Customer Insights team, you will play a key role in driving data-driven decisions across our marketing organization, working closely with teams such as User Growth, Acquisition, and CRM. In this role, you will use a dataset of millions of customers to unlock powerful insights and build a deep understanding about our customer behavior, which is directly translated to impactful marketing strategies.

From building segmentations and developing customer-level prediction models (like churn probability and customer lifetime value) to generating insights and creating scalable business reports, you'll have the opportunity to work on a wide variety of projects. With endless possibilities to explore customer journeys and turn analysis into action, this role offers both strategic influence and hands-on analytical work in a fast-paced, data-rich environment.

Your Key Responsibilities Will Include


Conduct deep-dive analyses and insights on customer behavior to identify opportunities and recommend actions.
Build and improve customer segmentations to enable targeted marketing strategies.
Build reporting models using dbt and Looker dashboards to monitor business performance and support the teams on their day-to-day operations as well as the management on high-level business planning.
Translate complex analytical findings into clear, actionable recommendations for business stakeholders.
Collaborate closely with marketing, data engineering, and product teams to ensure data quality and accessibility.


Qualifications


You have a Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
You have gained professional experience in a high-paced environment (early-stage startup is a plus) and consistently delivered high-quality results, taking ownership of tasks and driving them to completion.
You have strong foundations in SQL and you are comfortable using git and python.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets and generate insightful visualizations.
You have excellent communication and presentation skills.


Additional Information


A ‚Ç¨1000 annual L&D budget as well as individual coaching options to ensure you have plenty of opportunities to learn, grow and achieve your goals
26 days of vacation, +1 day every year up to a maximum of 30 days
A mobility budget of 30 EUR per month with NAVIT, which you can use individually for Uber, BVG and many other providers
A cool discount on your Urban Sports Club membership
Attractive company pension options
Unlimited access to an e-learning and development platform, MyAcademy, including online German courses
Online discounts with Corporate Benefits and Future Bens
A cool discount off your personal Flink orders; be the first to test out new products!
A modern and dog-friendly office in the heart of Berlin - lots of delicious lunch spots available within short walking distance

You will tackle a variety of problems ranging from shaping critical business decisions to investigating our production systems and recommend improvements.

Fulfillment is responsible for Lyft‚Äôs Matching algorithm and rides‚Äô cost computation. On the Fulfillment analytics team, you will report to a Team Manager that manages multiple functions including Product and Data Analysts. Our team is part of the bigger Marketplace organization which is responsible for accelerating the growth of the business and for delivering our top business/company goals around financial metrics and marketplace performance.

As a data analyst on our team, you will initially focus on our Cost Computation product and will be responsible for delivering accurate and reliable signals in dynamic marketplace conditions. You will influence existing/future strategies and product roadmaps through your data analysis, market insights, and visual comms. We‚Äôre looking for a data-oriented and process-driven individual who has extraordinary attention to detail and a track record of analytical problem-solving.

Support marketplace operations to provide quality analysis, forecasting and reporting to stakeholders.
Develop expertise in the cost and conversion domain, identify problem areas and provide actionable insights on improvements, and support cross-functional initiatives to improve existing products and develop new ones.
Operate within Rideshare decision-making frameworks with a critical lens, evaluating areas of improvement and business growth opportunities.
Work closely with the Data Scientists on model improvements and experimentation analysis to increase signal accuracy and reliability.
Prepare regular business reviews for leadership, highlighting key areas of focus.
Analyze data, conduct research and synthesize feedback into plans, processes and playbooks.
Roll up your sleeves and get stuff done. No one can be counted on to execute faster or better than you.
Identify opportunities and make them happen.


Experience:


3-5+ years of experience in a high growth environment in data analytics and/or strategic consulting.
Very strong attention to detail, experience developing processes to improve efficiency.
Proficient in SQL and quantitative analysis, you can deep dive into large amounts of data, draw meaningful insights, dissect business issues and draw actionable conclusions.
Outcome-driven approach to developing recommendations and demonstrated ability to develop a story and execution plan to support our goals and objectives.
Exceptional communication (listening, written, and oral) skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations targeted to the audience in question.
A drive to understand the core issues along with the determination to uncover the solution.
Excels at dealing with ambiguity and change management.
Experienced with cross-functional work and good stakeholder management skills.

Mental health benefits

Child care and pet benefits

Title: Data Analyst, Fulfillment
Description:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.

Data analysis is critical for Lyft‚Äôs products and decision-making. As a Data Analyst on the cross-functional team, you will work in a dynamic environment, where we embrace moving quickly to build the world‚Äôs best transportation. You will tackle a variety of problems ranging from shaping critical business decisions to investigating our production systems and recommend improvements.

Fulfillment is responsible for Lyft‚Äôs Matching algorithm and rides‚Äô cost computation. On the Fulfillment analytics team, you will report to a Team Manager that manages multiple functions including Product and Data Analysts. Our team is part of the bigger Marketplace organization which is responsible for accelerating the growth of the business and for delivering our top business/company goals around financial metrics and marketplace performance.

As a data analyst on our team, you will initially focus on our Cost Computation product and will be responsible for delivering accurate and reliable signals in dynamic marketplace conditions. You will influence existing/future strategies and product roadmaps through your data analysis, market insights, and visual comms. We‚Äôre looking for a data-oriented and process-driven individual who has extraordinary attention to detail and a track record of analytical problem-solving.

Responsibilities:


Support marketplace operations to provide quality analysis, forecasting and reporting to stakeholders.
Develop expertise in the cost and conversion domain, identify problem areas and provide actionable insights on improvements, and support cross-functional initiatives to improve existing products and develop new ones.
Operate within Rideshare decision-making frameworks with a critical lens, evaluating areas of improvement and business growth opportunities.
Work closely with the Data Scientists on model improvements and experimentation analysis to increase signal accuracy and reliability.
Prepare regular business reviews for leadership, highlighting key areas of focus.
Analyze data, conduct research and synthesize feedback into plans, processes and playbooks.
Roll up your sleeves and get stuff done. No one can be counted on to execute faster or better than you.
Identify opportunities and make them happen.


Experience:


3-5+ years of experience in a high growth environment in data analytics and/or strategic consulting.
Very strong attention to detail, experience developing processes to improve efficiency.
Proficient in SQL and quantitative analysis, you can deep dive into large amounts of data, draw meaningful insights, dissect business issues and draw actionable conclusions.
Outcome-driven approach to developing recommendations and demonstrated ability to develop a story and execution plan to support our goals and objectives.
Exceptional communication (listening, written, and oral) skills with the ability to present findings and recommendations targeted to the audience in question.
A drive to understand the core issues along with the determination to uncover the solution.
Excels at dealing with ambiguity and change management.
Experienced with cross-functional work and good stakeholder management skills.


Benefits:


Extended health and dental coverage options, along with life insurance and disability benefits
Mental health benefits
Family building benefits
Child care and pet benefits
Access to a Lyft funded Health Care Savings Account
RRSP plan to help save for your future
In addition to provincial observed holidays, salaried team members are covered under Lyft's flexible paid time off policy. The policy allows team members to take off as much time as they need (with manager approval). Hourly team members get 15 days paid time off, with an additional day for each year of service
Lyft is proud to support new parents with 18 weeks of paid time off, designed as a top-up plan to complement provincial programs. Biological, adoptive, and foster parents are all eligible.
Subsidized commuter benefits

Description:

Summary:

We are currently seeking a Senior Data Engineer to join our rapidly growing engineering team. This role is for someone who is passionate about building innovative data solutions and being exposed to new challenges and technologies while making an impact.

This role is available to candidates across Canada, excluding Quebec. If you are local to one of our hubs (Burnaby, Calgary, or Toronto) then you will be expected to be in office twice per week on days of your choice. If you are not local to our hubs, then you may work remotely across Canada, but our offices are open to you if you would like to visit.

Our data engineering team is driven to deliver an incredible experience to our customers. As a Senior Data Engineer at Clio, you will build data pipelines and data warehouses from scratch, as well as make data sets accessible to our partner teams by writing great production code. We move quickly, work with new state of the art technologies, and are motivated by solving complex problems.

A day in the life might look like:


Implement data ingestion techniques (streaming and batch) using best practices in data modeling, ETL/ELT processes by leveraging AWS technologies and data tools
Design, build, and maintain data transformation pipelines consolidating various data sources (streaming or batch) into specific data lakes/data warehouses
Collaborate with engineers to help adopt best practices in data system creation, data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation
Develop prototype or "proof of concept" implementations of projects where the technical solution is unknown or unproven


What you may have:


Deep experience in software development as well as data engineering
Proficiency in at least one major language (e.g. Python, Scala, Ruby) and SQL, striving to write elegant and maintainable code, and comfortability with picking up new technologies
Hands-on experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS and Terraform are preferred)
Experience with streaming and batch data tools: Spark, Kafka, Airflow
Advanced data warehousing experience working with Databricks or similar
Experience building data pipelines and the infrastructure required to deploy data models and dashboards that allow data visualization
Exceptional collaboration and communication skills and ability to derive clarity in ambiguous environments
You are an advocate for the data trustworthiness and product excellence of the data platform you build
You are a self-starter and can lead projects with minimum supervision
You enjoy mentoring junior engineers and are invested in their growth


What you will find here:

Compensation is one of the main components of Clio‚Äôs Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.

Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits, dental, and vision insurance
Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, and Dublin) to be in office minimum 2 days per week on our Anchor Days.
Flexible time off policy, with an encouraged 20 days off per year.
$2000 annual counseling benefit
RRSP matching and RESP contribution
Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About mytorso.ai

mytorso.ai is an ambitious early-stage digital health startup based in the vibrant tech hub of Vancouver, BC. We are on a mission to empower individuals to optimize their resilience and overall wellness by delivering holistic, data-driven insights that connect breath form, core stability, and nervous system regulation. We achieve this by combining our proprietary wearable technology with industry-leading wellness wearables, health apps, and cutting-edge AI, we offer data-driven feedback and highly personalized plans that help users thrive.




We are passionate about harnessing technology to unlock new potentials in human wellness. If you're looking to join a company that's making a real difference in people's lives and want to gain hands-on startup experience from experienced innovators, we encourage you to apply!




Position Overview

mytorso.ai seeks a talented, motivated Intermediate Data Scientist enthusiastic about leveraging Generative AI to accelerate development and unlock new possibilities in health data analysis. You will be pivotal in developing our platform's core intelligence, starting with an initial area of focus on transforming raw sensor data from our wearable into meaningful, breath form classifications and personalized breath signatures.

Subsequently, your expertise will be crucial for creating a holistic wellness platform. This will involve integrating data from various wearables and health apps, and developing an AI Agent with conversational capabilities to enable intuitive, user-led exploration of aggregated health data.

This is a unique chance to contribute to foundational areas of development, build core technology, and grow your skills in a dynamic, supportive environment.




What You'll Do:

End-to-End Model Development: Design, develop, train, validate, and deploy robust machine learning models for time-series classification, anomaly detection, and pattern recognition, specifically tailored to physiological sensor data (e.g., breath mechanics, core stability signals).
Data Pipeline & Feature Engineering: Develop and refine data preprocessing pipelines for ingesting, cleaning, and preparing large volumes of proprietary and third-party sensor data. Engineer and select impactful features from raw data streams to optimize model performance and extract meaningful physiological insights.
Holistic Platform Development: Contribute to the design of data aggregation and normalization strategies for the holistic Wellness platform, integrating data from diverse commercial wearables and health applications.
AI Agent & Conversational Interface Development: Design, develop, and refine components of an AI Agent, including its conversational interface (leveraging NLP and dialogue management), to enable intuitive, user-led exploration and understanding of aggregated health data.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, product, and health science teams to define data requirements, translate complex problems into data science solutions, and integrate models into our platform.
Insight Generation & Communication: Analyze data to uncover actionable insights and trends. Clearly document methodologies, experiments, and results, and effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Continuous Learning & Innovation: Stay current with the latest advancements in data science, machine learning, signal processing, wearable technology, AI agents, and GenAI, particularly within the digital health domain, and proactively identify opportunities for innovation.




Who You Are:

Education & Experience: Master‚Äôs or Ph.D. in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, Biomedical Engineering with 3+ years of demonstrable hands-on experience in data science or machine learning roles, including a proven record of developing and deploying ML/AI models.
Python & Data Science Ecosystem: Strong proficiency in Python and its core data science libraries (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Machine Learning Expertise: Solid experience with a range of machine learning algorithms (especially for time-series analysis, classification, and signal processing), robust feature engineering techniques, and comprehensive model evaluation methodologies.
AI Agent / Conversational AI Knowledge: Experience or strong foundational knowledge in developing AI agents, conversational AI systems, Natural Language Processing (NLP), and dialogue management.
Cloud Experience: Proficiency in developing and deploying ML/AI on cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, Azure) and MLOps principles.
Data Handling & Pipelines: Proven experience in developing data preprocessing pipelines and working with complex, potentially noisy, sensor data.
Generative AI Acumen: Demonstrated interest and practical experience of leveraging GenAI tools to enhance data science workflows.
Analytical & Problem-Solving Prowess: A strong analytical mindset with the ability to tackle complex, ill-defined problems, critically evaluate data, and derive actionable insights.
Communication & Collaboration: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to articulate complex technical concepts clearly and concisely to diverse audiences. A collaborative team player who thrives in an agile startup environment.
Adaptability & Initiative: A proactive learner who quickly adapts to new technologies and methodologies, and takes initiative to drive projects forward.




Desirable Skills (Nice-to-Haves):

Experience working directly with physiological sensor data (e.g., ECG, PPG, EMG, accelerometer, gyroscope).
Previous experience in the digital health, wellness, or health tech industry.




Why Join mytorso.ai?

Make a Real Impact: Contribute to a product significantly improving health and well-being.
Cutting-Edge Technology: Work with proprietary wearable tech, advanced AI/ML, and leverage GenAI in digital health.
Foundational Role: Join a passionate founding team; your work directly shapes our product and culture.
Growth & Learning: Unparalleled opportunities for professional growth and increasing responsibilities.
Collaborative & Innovative Culture: We foster open communication, collaboration, and continuous innovation.
